translated: The Guide
The Reversal Section
The Analysis
The Analysis of the Mode That Purifies
Herein, what is the mode that purifies?
The verse “When the question is answered” .

original: Yathā āyasmā ajito pārāyane bhagavantaṁ pañhaṁ pucchati—
translated: As to how the venerable Ajita asked the Blessed One a question in the Pārāyanavagga:
“By what is the world obstructed?🔽By what is it not illuminated?
What, they say, is its smear?
What is its great terror?”
“The world is obstructed by ignorance,
(Ajita, the Blessed One said)
It is not illuminated by seclusion and heedlessness.
I say that talk is its smear,

original: Dukkhamassa mahabbhayan”ti.🔽“Kenassu nivuto loko”ti pañhe “avijjāya nivuto loko”ti bhagavā padaṁ sodheti, no ca ārambhaṁ.🔽“Kenassu nappakāsatī”ti pañhe “vivicchā pamādā nappakāsatī”ti bhagavā padaṁ sodheti, no ca ārambhaṁ.
analyzed: dukkham assa mahabbhayanti  kenassu nivutaḥ loko ti pañhe avijjāya nivutaḥ loko ti bhagavā padam sodheti no ca ārambha  nappakāsati iti pañhe vivicchā pamādā nappakāsati iti bhagavā padam sodheti no ca ārambha
translated: Suffering is its great terror.”🔽In the question “By what is the world obstructed?” the Blessed One purifies the term “obstructed by ignorance” but not the instigation.🔽In the question “By what is it not illuminated?” the Blessed One purifies the term “it is not illuminated by seclusion and heedlessness” but not the instigation.

original: “Kissābhilepanaṁ brūsī”ti pañhe “jappābhilepanaṁ brūmī”ti bhagavā padaṁ sodheti, no ca ārambhaṁ.
analyzed: kissa abhilepanam brūsi iti pañhe jappa abhilepanam brūmi iti bhagavā padam sodha iti no ca ārambha
translated: In the question “What, they say, is its smear?” the Blessed One purifies the term “I say that talk is its smear” but not the instigation.

original: “Kiṁsu tassa mahabbhayan”ti pañhe “dukkhamassa mahabbhayan”ti suddho ārambho.
analyzed: kisu tassa mahabbhayanti pañhe dukkham assa mahabbhayanti suddhaḥ ārambho
translated: “What is his great fear?” The answer is “Pain is his great fear.”
Hence the Blessed One said: “The world is enveloped in ignorance” .
“Streams flow in all directions,
(So said the venerable Ajita)
What is the obstruction to the streams?
Tell me the restraint of the streams,
By what are the streams blocked?”
“Whatever streams there are in the world,
(The Blessed One said to Ajita)
Their obstruction is mindfulness.
I declare the restraint of the streams,
By wisdom they are blocked.”

original: “Savanti sabbadhi sotā, sotānaṁ kiṁ nivāraṇan”ti pañhe “yāni sotāni lokasmiṁ, sati tesaṁ nivāraṇan”ti bhagavā padaṁ sodheti, no ca ārambhaṁ.
analyzed: savanti sabbadhi sotā sotānam kim pañhe yāni sotāni lokasmi sati tesam bhagavā padam sodha iti no ca
translated: “Streams flow in all directions. What is the obstruction to the streams?” The Blessed One clarifies the term “Whatever streams there are in the world, their obstruction is mindfulness.” He does not clarify the beginning.

original: “Sotānaṁ saṁvaraṁ brūhi, kena sotā pidhīyare”ti pañhe “sotānaṁ saṁvaraṁ brūmi, paññāyete pidhīyare”ti suddho ārambho.
analyzed: sotānam savaram brūhi kena sotā pidhīyare iti pañhe sotānam savaram brūmi paññāyete pidhīyare iti suddhaḥ ārambhaḥ
translated: “Tell me the restraint of the streams. By what are the streams blocked?” The answer is “I declare the restraint of the streams. By wisdom they are blocked.” This is a pure beginning.

analyzed: tena āha bhagavā yāni sotāni lokasmin ti
translated: Hence the Blessed One said: “Whatever streams there are in the world” .
“Wisdom and mindfulness,
(So said the venerable Ajita)
“Name-and-form, good sir,”
Please tell me this,
How does it cease?”
The question🔽“Ajita, I will tell you
The answer to the question you ask,

analyzed: yattha nāman ca rūpañca  asesam uparujjhati  viññāṇassa nirodhena
translated: Where name-and-form🔽Cease without remainder,🔽Through the cessation of consciousness,
There it ceases.”
The introduction is pure.

analyzed: tena āha bhagavā yam etam pañham apucchi iti
translated: Therefore the Blessed One said: “The answer to the question you ask.”

original: Yattha evaṁ suddho ārambho, so pañho visajjito bhavati.
analyzed: yattha evam suddhaḥ ārambho saḥ pañhaḥ visajjitaḥ bhavati
translated: Where the introduction is pure, the question is answered.

original: Yattha pana ārambho asuddho, na tāva so pañho visajjito bhavati.
analyzed: yattha pana ārambhaḥ asuddhaḥ na tāva so pañhaḥ visajjitaḥ bhavati
translated: But where the introduction is impure, the question is not answered.

analyzed: tena āha āyasmā mahākaccāyanaḥ vissajjitamhi pañhā iti
translated: Therefore the venerable Maha Kaccana said: “The question has been answered.”
The mode of expression is purified.
